page.title: 03Mixed Farming - Henwood
page.content: Bradley's farm, owned by Merton College, consists of over 300 acres of grassland and winter planted barley, which yields 2.94 tons per acre. Grain grown for fodder is not sprayed extensively to eradicate weeds as wild oats in the barley can be tolerated. Grain sold to merchants must be free from weed seed. In the last two years the grain price has fallen from Â£108 to Â£94.50per ton. The farm is run by the farmer, his two sons and one labourer. They breed dairy cows, keep a milking herd of 120 cows and fatten for beef. Cows are milked at 5.30am and in the after- noon. The new milking parlour is {computerized;} when the milk stops flowing from the udder the pressure in the cups is released and they are sucked off the teats. Last year each cow averaged 7000litres of milk.
